title: Rustdoc `doc_auto_cfg` incorrectly reporting an item with conditionally default type params as conditional

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When a generic type parameter is conditionally default `doc_auto_cfg` reports whole item as conditional.

I tried this code:

```rust
#[cfg(not(feature = "std"))]                       
pub enum ReadError<Decode, Read> {                 
    /// Reading from a reader failed.              
    Read(Read),                                    
    /// Decoding the value failed.                 
    Decode(Decode),                                
}                                                  

#[cfg(feature = "std")]                            
pub enum ReadError<Decode, Read = std::io::Error> {
    /// Reading from a reader failed.              
    Read(Read),                                    
    /// Decoding the value failed.                 
    Decode(Decode),                                
}                                                  
```

I expected to see this happen: The resulting documentation says that the default parameter is only available with `std`

Instead, this happened: The resulting documentation says that `ReadError` is only available with `std`

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.72.0-nightly (1c53407e8 2023-05-28)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 1c53407e8c7cc922d718bde61ca34f47b6d2120f
commit-date: 2023-05-28
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.72.0-nightly
LLVM version: 16.0.4
```

CC #43781
